tags: this was literally so fun thank you
summary: Which AM character do you think would hate minions and who would love them? 💅👀💀
question: Which AM character do you think would hate minions and who would love them? 💅👀💀
answer:
This ask is so funny to me omfg

Okay here we go:

Andi-I feel like she would think they’re kinda cute and maybe do some craft related-diy minion stuff idk. But she doesn’t actually like the movies/memes

Buffy-complains about minion memes that are on Facebook. Groans every time she sees a minion related item. Threatened to burn Andi’s minion crafts.

Cyrus-when he first started learning how to use the internet/social media, he enjoyed minion memes but not minions themselves. But then he discovered actual good memes and abandoned minions. Presently he doesn’t really care about minions one way or another.

Jonah-I feel like when he was a kid he would have liked the movies (cuz the first one came out when he was like 7) but then he grew out of it obviously. He seems too chill to actually hate minions, but he internally cringes every time he sees one because he is reminded of his past of liking them as a kid.

Marty-hates them. Helped construct a plan with Buffy to set Andi’s minion crafts on fire without Andi knowing. Sometimes while Buffy and Marty are warming up for track practice, they go on these long rants about how horrible they are.

TJ-likes them ironically. He can’t help but buy dollar store minion crap every time he sees it. Sends Buffy minion memes to piss her off.

Bowie-idk why but I feel like he genuinely likes minion stuff and I don’t really have a reason. He just seems to happy to hate anything I guess

Cece-Hates them with a burning passion. Too obnoxious. Didn’t allow Andi to watch the movies when she was younger

alyssa | 18 | artist

main: @ryanhaywood

tags: also feel free to message me asking to reblog your art
i will! i love seeing people doing what they love
summary: reblog art. reblog art. reblog art.
body:
reblog art. reblog art. reblog art.

if you see fanart in the andi mack tag, reblog it. i don’t care if you think it’s ugly, or not well done, or rushed. art needs to be encouraged. art is meant to be shared. let people know they aren’t wasting their time.

blog.name: ibroughtachallah
blog.title: you shouldn't chave
blog.description:
let's just say i live on these two boys named tj kippen & cyrus goodman.

13.

title: Where It All Began - Epilogue
body:
Previous Chapter

The planning for the wedding went amazingly. In just 3 to 4 months, Cyrus Goodman and TJ Kippen were happily married. To make it less confusing, none of them chose to take any last names; but they were still completely fine with their decisions.

The real reason why they didn’t take each other’s last names was became their names already sounded badass anyway, so why would they change them?

That’s what TJ thought, and Cyrus happily agreed.

Andi and Walker graduated their respective colleges and flocked back to Shadyside, where they ended up working at the same art studio. They became best friends, and helped each other make art, reminding them both of Walker’s mural that they did together back in 8th grade.

Marty and Buffy got together, leaving their “virtual relationship” days behind them. They moved in together, and got ready to start a family. Buffy’s athleticism was still there, and became a PE coach at Jefferson, while Marty became a PE coach at Grant. They were soulmates, which was part of the reason why Marty proposed to Buffy when he dropped her off at Jefferson one day. They got happily engaged, and were planning to start a family once they were ready to.

Amber ended up getting married to Andi, with the help of Walker. Walker made a painting of Andi, which hid secret words in the painting, which Andi was oblivious to. Amber had to help her out with finding the words. It took over 2 hours, but it was all worth it in the end. Once Andi said the words, “will you marry me”, Amber was already on one knee.

Walker and Jonah got married around the same time TJ and Cyrus did. They lived a happy and chill life, without any kids, which they were going to plan later in their life. Jonah became a musician, and started to perform gigs around the city, state, and later around the country. He gave a lot of credit to Bowie, who taught him how to play the guitar in the first place. Jonah decided to start saying docious magocious again, which made Buffy extremely happy.

Lastly, we get back to TJ and Cyrus. They started their family fairly quickly, and ended up adopting two kids - a boy and a girl. Their names were CJ and Rosie. Cyrus continued to go to film school, even after starting his family with TJ. Once Cyrus was finished with film school, he went back to college to study Psychology, to make his parents proud. Once Cyrus was finished with that, he decided to work at Jefferson, where he became the guidance counselor and also helped out with the Film Club. Both of his degrees were all worth it. Despite TJ not being drafted into the NBA, he too decided to work at Jefferson, becoming the basketball coach. He decided to tell his captaincy stories, which bored out the team a lot, but inspired them.

All of our people decided to move back to Shadyside, where they all met, and where they all will stay for the rest of their lives.

CJ and Rosie looked out the car window. Their lives in Shadyside were pretty good. They had the best parents in the world, as they looked in front of them.

“They’re in loooooveeeeee.” Rosie teased.

“Rosie, sit down. We don’t need to tease you about Jason, do we?” TJ replied, as he parked the car.

Rosie sat down in her seat, turning red due to embarrassment. CJ looked out the car window in astonishment as he adjusted his glasses. Despite being adopted, CJ already had traits from Cyrus. He was unathletic, smart, and so many other things. Rosie took from TJ. She was athletic, played basketball, and decided to try out for the basketball team, where Buffy was the coach.

“Alright guys, we’re here - get out of the car.” Cyrus announced, as he opened the car door for everyone.

TJ and Cyrus looked at each other. They were happily married with their muffin wedding rings, and they finally got their life started. They watched as CJ and Rosie, despite being middle schoolers, enjoying their time on the playground.

“That was us, right?” TJ asked, kissing Cyrus on the cheek.

“Nah, we were just on the swings the entire time telling each other about our stuff.” Cyrus replied, blushing.

As CJ and Rosie were playing tag on the playground, TJ and Cyrus decided to go over to the swings.

“Can you still do an underdog?” Cyrus asked playfully.

TJ looked at Cyrus as if he was asking the dumbest question in the world. “Of COURSE I can!” He replied, as he got off his swing. He got behind Cyrus, and started to push him as hard as he could, waiting for him to get high enough.

Once Cyrus was high enough on the swing, TJ timed everything perfectly. As Cyrus was still up high in the air, TJ yelled, “Underdog!” as he ran under the swing.

“They’re adorable.” CJ whispered to Rosie, who was smiling.

“They really are.” Rosie replied. “They knew each other since middle school, pff, they’re old.”

As TJ and Cyrus got out of breath from pushing each other on the swings, Cyrus sighed as he jumped off the swing.

“CJ, Rosie, get over here!” He yelled, as they ran over to the couple.

TJ pointed at the swings, and started to speak. “Your dad and I met here. I was a jerk, but it didn’t matter to him at all.” Cyrus smiled at him. “We became friends here, and here we are again.”

Cyrus smiled, before speaking as well. “This is where it all began.”

Amber ended up getting married to Andi, with the help of Walker. Walker made a painting of Andi, which hid secret words in the painting, which Andi was oblivious to. Amber had to help her out with finding the words. It took over 2 hours, but it was all worth it in the end. Once Andi said the words, “will you marry me”, Amber was already on one knee.

Walker and Jonah got married around the same time TJ and Cyrus did. They lived a happy and chill life, without any kids, which they were going to plan later in their life. Jonah became a musician, and started to perform gigs around the city, state, and later around the country. He gave a lot of credit to Bowie, who taught him how to play the guitar in the first place. Jonah decided to start saying docious magocious again, which made Buffy extremely happy.

Lastly, we get back to TJ and Cyrus. They started their family fairly quickly, and ended up adopting two kids - a boy and a girl. Their names were CJ and Rosie. Cyrus continued to go to film school, even after starting his family with TJ. Once Cyrus was finished with film school, he went back to college to study Psychology, to make his parents proud. Once Cyrus was finished with that, he decided to work at Jefferson, where he became the guidance counselor and also helped out with the Film Club. Both of his degrees were all worth it. Despite TJ not being drafted into the NBA, he too decided to work at Jefferson, becoming the basketball coach. He decided to tell his captaincy stories, which bored out the team a lot, but inspired them.

All of our people decided to move back to Shadyside, where they all met, and where they all will stay for the rest of their lives.

CJ and Rosie looked out the car window. Their lives in Shadyside were pretty good. They had the best parents in the world, as they looked in front of them.

“They’re in loooooveeeeee.” Rosie teased.

“Rosie, sit down. We don’t need to tease you about Jason, do we?” TJ replied, as he parked the car.

Rosie sat down in her seat, turning red due to embarrassment. CJ looked out the car window in astonishment as he adjusted his glasses. Despite being adopted, CJ already had traits from Cyrus. He was unathletic, smart, and so many other things. Rosie took from TJ. She was athletic, played basketball, and decided to try out for the basketball team, where Buffy was the coach.

“Alright guys, we’re here - get out of the car.” Cyrus announced, as he opened the car door for everyone.

TJ and Cyrus looked at each other. They were happily married with their muffin wedding rings, and they finally got their life started. They watched as CJ and Rosie, despite being middle schoolers, enjoying their time on the playground.

“That was us, right?” TJ asked, kissing Cyrus on the cheek.

“Nah, we were just on the swings the entire time telling each other about our stuff.” Cyrus replied, blushing.

As CJ and Rosie were playing tag on the playground, TJ and Cyrus decided to go over to the swings.

“Can you still do an underdog?” Cyrus asked playfully.

TJ looked at Cyrus as if he was asking the dumbest question in the world. “Of COURSE I can!” He replied, as he got off his swing. He got behind Cyrus, and started to push him as hard as he could, waiting for him to get high enough.

Once Cyrus was high enough on the swing, TJ timed everything perfectly. As Cyrus was still up high in the air, TJ yelled, “Underdog!” as he ran under the swing.

“They’re adorable.” CJ whispered to Rosie, who was smiling.

“They really are.” Rosie replied. “They knew each other since middle school, pff, they’re old.”

As TJ and Cyrus got out of breath from pushing each other on the swings, Cyrus sighed as he jumped off the swing.

“CJ, Rosie, get over here!” He yelled, as they ran over to the couple.

TJ pointed at the swings, and started to speak. “Your dad and I met here. I was a jerk, but it didn’t matter to him at all.” Cyrus smiled at him. “We became friends here, and here we are again.”

Cyrus smiled, before speaking as well. “This is where it all began.”

summary: Math Tutoring Cyrus always sat this close to him. Legs touching, arms brushing against each other, leaning closer to look at...
body:
Math Tutoring

Cyrus always sat this close to him. Legs touching, arms brushing against each other, leaning closer to look at whatever was in front of them. TJ could hardly think of a time when Cyrus didn’t sit this close to him. He couldn’t, however, think of any of those times that had as much of an effect on him as right now. TJ’s math book sat open on the Goodman’s coffee table, his practice test sitting on his lap, where Cyrus practically was, too. TJ repeated the mantra in his head, that “this is normal, pay attention. This is normal”, but in the past few weeks, almost everything about how TJ thought of his friend seemed to scream not normal.

TJ’s heart rattled, echoing in his ribcage. Although it was snowing in blankets outside, TJ felt the overwhelming need to remove his sweater. He took a shaky breath in and out and rubbed his sweaty palms against his jeans.

“TJ? Seriously?” Cyrus huffed, and TJ tore his gaze from the window, where he was presumably zoning out. “You aren’t going to pass if you don’t pay attention.”

“Sorry, I’m just… a little overwhelmed. Do you think that we could take a break for a minute?” TJ’s voice sounded small, and Cyrus seemed to soften a little at that, before a worried expression took over his face.

“Yeah, we’ve been working for a while. Sorry.” He looked sheepish and immediately stood up, stretching his arms above his head. “Would you like something to drink?” he asked as he walked away, his head still partially turned toward TJ.

TJ sat up straight and looked behind his shoulder to where Cyrus was entering the kitchen.

“I’ll have some water.” TJ said, noticing how dry his throat was. He quickly removed his sweatshirt and peered back to the kitchen entryway again, leaning back a little farther until he could see Cyrus, who seemed to be trying to calm down. TJ leaned back so far he felt the couch begin to tip under the weight shift, and quickly leaned forward, his heart and stomach lurching. A moment later, Cyrus arrived with two glasses of water and a plate of crackers.

“We don’t have much in the way of snacks, but crackers are always nice.” He smiled softly, and TJ couldn’t help but smile back. Cyrus sat down again, this time a little farther away from TJ than he was before. TJ picked a cracker from the tray, munching and avoiding eye contact with Cyrus until he could extinguish this startling new feeling of disappointment.

Cyrus opened the math book again, and TJ was able to pay attention for a record 5 minutes, before he found himself inching closer to Cyrus. He wondered if he had always been the one to scoot closer, or if the other boy also craved the close proximity. Soon again, after a few problems, their legs were touching, and Cyrus was leaning across TJ to point to problems and numbers that TJ was once again having trouble focusing on.

TJ leaned forward to turn the page, meeting Cyrus who had also moved to turn it. TJ wasn’t sure he’d ever been this close to Cyrus’ face before. He could feel his breath, and he could see just how impossibly long Cyrus’ eyelashes were. TJ felt his heart beat once, hard. Then twice, then a million times with wild abandon. Their hands were hovering over the page corner – so close, but not actually touching. Cyrus blushed and then leaned back. A millisecond that felt like an eternity. A laugh bubbled up from TJ, and he turned the page.

An awkward silence descended for only moments, before they were right back to where they were before, with TJ zoning out and Cyrus being impossibly close. 

“I think we’ve done enough for today, it’s getting pretty late.” Cyrus admitted eventually. TJ felt simultaneous relief and disappointment as he closed his book and slid it into his backpack.

“Agreed. I think the test tomorrow isn’t going to be so bad. Thanks for the help, Cyrus. Really.” TJ flashed a genuine smile at Cyrus and felt his own face heat up. 

“Of course. You know I’m always here to help.” Cyrus tapped TJ’s leg before standing up, grabbing their snack dishes from the table.

“Wait, Cy.” TJ mumbled, standing up and slinging his backpack over his shoulder.

“Yeah?” Cyrus looked up at him through his lashes and TJ felt his heartbeat quicken again. 

“Nothing. See you tomorrow.” TJ settled on his response and quickly walked out the door.

So, maybe the way he felt about Cyrus Goodman was anything but normal, but he would figure that out after he passed his math test.

summary: Someone should write a fanfic where both Tyrus and Ambi are a thing, but neither TJ or Amber have told the GHC that they are...
question: Someone should write a fanfic where both Tyrus and Ambi are a thing, but neither TJ or Amber have told the GHC that they are siblings and they have a series of inside jokes where they pretend to have not previously known eachother and scramble to keep Cyrus and Andi apart at the Kippen household when both are over. Jonah knows since he dated Amber but since everyone thinks he's oblivious he doesn't let on and enjoys the ruse.

blog.title: Good 'ol Tippen Jippen
blog.description: lou | 19 | she/her | should probably focus more on my degree and less on tyrus but here we are

summary: Hey everyone. My name is Lou and although I’m not new to the Andi Mack fandom, I have decided to finally make a blog for it...
body:
Hey everyone. My name is Lou and although I’m not new to the Andi Mack fandom, I have decided to finally make a blog for it instead of creeping in the tags on my other main. I love to write and i guess y’all have seriously inspired me because I love everything about the content from this fandom, so I thought i’d contribute.

Please please give me a follow !
